Jean-Talon Street / [[Park Avenue, Montreal|Park Avenue]][http://www.stm.info/English/metro/Parc.pdf Map] |}} '''Parc''' is a station on the [[Line 5 Blue (Montreal Metro)|Blue Line]] of the [[Montreal Metro]] [[Rapid transit|rapid transit system]], operated by the [[SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al]] (STM). It is located in the [[Park Extension]] district of the [[VillerayâSaint MichelâPark Extension]] borough of [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]].[http://www.stm.info/English/metro/a-m60.htm Parc Metro Station] The station was built inside the extreme western part of the [[Canadian Pacific Railway|Canadian Pacific's]] former Park Avenue Station, and connects with [[Agence mÃ©tropolitaine de transport]] (AMT) [[Parc (AMT)|Parc Station]]. == Overview == It is a normal [[side platform]] station. The entrance to the station was built within the former men's smoking room of the now disused [[Jean-Talon railway station|Park Avenue Station]], built in 1931. The platform level of the station features a frieze by Huguette Desjardins, and the skylight at the foot of the stairs to the exit contains a sculpture called ''MÃ©tamorphose d'Icare'' by Claire Sarrasin, an homage to the local Greek community. ==Origin of name== Parc comes from [[Park Avenue (Montreal)|Park Avenue]] (Avenue du Parc), which is a main north/south thoroughfare in Montreal. Park Avenue gets its name from the fact that part of it runs along [[Mount Royal]] Park. ==Connecting bus routes== {{Main|SociÃ©tÃ© de transport de MontrÃ©al}} {{Main|List of Montreal Bus Routes}}
